author: Tanveer Mann
title: Here’s everything you need to know about the new ÂŁ20 note
text:
The new ÂŁ20 notes are set to be introduced by 2020 (Picture: Bank Of England) Whether you love or hate the new ÂŁ5 notes, you’ll have toÂ get used to them because the Bank of England is making the next ÂŁ20 note plastic.Â 
The new shiny note will follow the polymer ÂŁ5 notes already in circulation and ÂŁ10 notes, which are on their way.
The move to the plastic notes was made to help keep cash ‘fit for purpose’ and to make it harder to make counterfeit copies.
Petition started to expel student who lit ÂŁ20 note in front of homeless man When will they be introduced? 
The new note will be made from polymer, which is said to be more durable and secure than paper notes.
They will be introduced in two years’ time, a Bank of England spokesman said.
So by 2020, all notes except the ÂŁ50 note will be made by plastic.
The note will feature British artist J.M.W. Turner on the front (Picture: SWNS) Who will feature on it? 
Governor of the Bank of England Mark Carney said: ‘I am delighted to announce that J.M.W. Turner has been chosen to appear on the next ÂŁ20 note.
‘Turner is perhaps the single most influential British artist of all time. His work was transformative for the art world. His influence spanned his lifetime and well beyond.’
Hereâ€™s how to spot a fake ÂŁ5 note Turner was chosen using the new character selection process, which involved a two month nomination period between May and July 2015,
In total 29,701 nominations were received for 590 characters.
Carney added: ‘The range and breadth of these nominations is testament to the UKâ€™s achievements in the arts. The Banknote Character Advisory Committee did an outstanding job of working through these nominations.
‘Their help in reaching this decision was invaluable.’
The polymer notes are said to be more durable and secure (Picture: Bank Of England) What will the note look like? 
The note will feature J.M.W. Turner’s self-portrait which is currently on display in the Tate Britain, one of his most significant paintings, The Fighting Temeraire, the quote ‘light is therefore colour’ from an 1818 lecture by him and his signature.
When do the old ÂŁ5 notes run out? Paper fivers are about to become collectibles Will they be meat-free? 
The Bank of England was criticised shorty after the new ÂŁ5 notes were introduced after it emerged that the new notes contained animal fat.
Yet despite an investigation and a legal battle, the bank said it would not withdraw the current notes from circulation as it would cost the tax payer too much.
But in terms of the ÂŁ20 notes, the bank has reportedly held off on signing supply contracts so that it can explore plant-based substitutes, and this would likely take a few months to trial.
A final decision on how they will be made will be announced in the summer.
